cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE ,. PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC TO?TY'S GOVERNMENT) PECRET.6; P. 5982.C A BINE T. TEE IRISH SITUATION AND THE HOUSE OF COM!IONS?r ROTE BY THE ACTING SECRETARY, CABINET..The following letter received by the Lord Privy Seal is circulated by his direction with a view to its early . consideration by the Cabinet.(Signed) THOMAS JONES, Acting Secretary, Cabinet.2, Whitehall Gardens,'s.W., 19th May, 1922.' -18th May, 1922.Dear Mr-.* Chamberlain, 'The refusal of Mr. Speaker to allow questions to be-asked, and the adjournment moved on matters relating to the lives and property of British subjects in Ireland prevents the House of Commons from carrying out the duty of protecting British Subjects in whatever part of the world they may be.We do not desire to impugn the ruling of Mr. Speaker, but we think it is the duty of the Government by a new Standing Order or otherwise to maintain the right of the House of Commons to protect British subjects,(Sgd.Cr, Dalrymple White W.
